clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Test a Marketed Drug in the Treatment of Menstrual Migraine (0462-072)
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Double-Blind, Randomized, Parallel-Group, Placebo Controlled Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Tolerability of Rizatriptan 10 mg Tablets for the Treatment of Menstrual Migraine

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to test the effectiveness of a marketed drug in the treatment of a menstrual migraine attack.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients with 2 hour pain relief: 4-point headache severity scale as recorded in patient diary

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients with 24-hr sustained pain relief: headache severity between 2 and 24 hrs post dose recorded in patient diary

intervention.intervention_name: MK0462, rizatriptan benzoate / Duration of Treatment -1day
Comparator: placebo / Duration of Treatment - 1 day

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Female patient at least 18 years old
- Patient has menses approximately monthly
- Patient has at least a 6 month history of migraine and at least a 6 month history of menstrual migraine
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant and/or nursing mother
- Cardiovascular disease
- Uncontrolled hypertension
